alert.note: Alert for Delaware (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 6:31PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following county, Delaware. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to nearly stationary thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of at least 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall persists longer more dangerous flash flooding will be possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Delhi, Meredith, Stamford, Hobart, Meridale, Kortright and East Delhi. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
